main.docTitle: Factories and Industrial Undertakings (Cartridge-Operated Fixing Tools) Regulations

section.name: s1
section.heading: Citation
section.content: These regulations may be cited as the Factories and Industrial Undertakings (Cartridge-Operated Fixing Tools) Regulations.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In these regulations, unless the context otherwise requires—
section.def: approved tool (認可工具) means a tool, including any part thereof, approved by the Commissioner under regulation 19; (L.N. 329 of 1988)
cartridge-operated fixing tool (槍彈推動打釘工具) means an instrument designed and used for driving pins into structural material, the driving force being derived from a cartridge;

def.name: CertificateOfCompetency
def.leadIn: certificate of competency (合資格證明書) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a certificate issued by a person who provides courses of training, approved by the Commissioner, in the operation of a tool; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: such other certificate approved by the Commissioner as being equivalent to a certificate referred to in paragraph (a);

section.def: construction site (建築地盤) means a place where construction work is undertaken and also any area in the immediate vicinity of any such place which is used for the storage of materials or plant used or intended to be used for the purpose of construction work;
direct-acting tool (直接推動工具) means a tool in which the driving force is transmitted to the pin directly from a cartridge;
ear protector (聽覺保護器) includes ear-muffs, ear plugs and ear valves;
indirect-acting tool (間接推動工具) means a tool in which the driving force is transmitted to the pin by means of an intervening piston with limited axial movement;
pin (釘) includes a nail, stud, eyelet, eyepin, fastener or other similar object which is driven into structural material by means of a tool;
protective equipment (防護設備) means safety goggles, safety helmets and ear protectors;
tool (工具) means a cartridge-operated fixing tool.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Application
section.content: These regulations apply in relation to the use of any tool in an industrial undertaking.

part.name: P2
part.heading: Duties of Contractors, Proprietors and Operators

section.name: s4
section.heading: Only approved tools to be used
section.content: No tool other than an approved tool shall be used in an industrial undertaking.

subsection.leadIn: Every tool shall be maintained in such condition that it can be operated only—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: when fitted with a splinter guard at right angles to the axis of the barrel and at the end of the barrel. In the case of a direct-acting tool the splinter guard shall be so maintained that the distance from the outer edge of the guard to the axis of the barrel shall not be less than 50 mm;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: when the splinter guard is in firm contact with the material to be pierced and the splinter guard and barrel are fully pressed home against the surface of the material;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: when the barrel and splinter guard are pressed against the surface of the material to be pierced with a pressure exceeding 5 kg; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in the case of a direct-acting tool, when the axis of the barrel is at an angle of less than 7 degrees to a line perpendicular to the work surface.

subsection.leadIn: Every tool shall be maintained in such condition that it cannot operate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: when the tool is being loaded;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: when the tool is dropped on to a hard surface from a height not exceeding 300 cm; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: when any part of the tool has been assembled incorrectly or when the separate parts required to be dismantled or manipulated for loading have not been firmly locked together.

subsection.content: Every tool shall be maintained properly and free from patent defects.
No pins other than those which correspond to the manufacturer’s specifications for the particular type and make of tool shall be used in the operation of that tool.
Pins, including their caps or rings, shall be of a size in conformity with the bore of the barrel of the tool.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Cartridges
section.content: No cartridges other than those which correspond to the manufacturer’s specifications for the particular type and make of tool shall be used in the operation of that tool.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Tool markings
section.leadIn: Every tool shall be kept clearly and permanently marked, in English or in Chinese, either on the tool or on a plate fixed to it, with—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the manufacturer’s name or trade mark;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the type or model of the tool; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: its serial number.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Storage of tool and ancillary equipment

subsection.content: A tool box, or other similar container, which is of strong construction and fitted with suitable means for locking it shall be provided for the storage of every tool, its cartridges, pins and ancillary equipment.
A loaded tool shall not be stored in the tool box or other container provided under paragraph (1).
While a tool is not required for use it shall be kept in the tool box, or other container, provided under paragraph (1), which shall be locked and stored in a secure place.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Tool box to contain instructions on care and operation of tool
section.leadIn: Every tool box, or other similar container, provided under regulation 9, shall contain a copy of the manufacturer’s instruction manual appropriate to the tool in English and Chinese giving the following information—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the procedure to be followed for loading, firing and dismantling the tool;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the procedure to be followed for dealing with delayed ignition for any cause;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: instructions on regular cleaning, oiling and inspection and the correct method of dismantling and reassembling the removable parts of the tool; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: instructions on the selection of recommended pins and cartridges for the tool together with a guide for distinguishing the strength of the charge contained in the cartridges.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Operators to hold certificates of competency

subsection.content: A tool shall not be used other than by a person who holds a certificate of competency.
A certificate of competency shall be in a form approved by the Commissioner.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Lighting and safe place of work
section.leadIn: The place in which a tool is used shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be suitably lit to the extent necessary to secure the operator’s safety; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: so far as is reasonably practicable, be made and kept safe to the extent that the operator shall have a firm foot-hold. (71 of 1989 s. 13)

section.name: s13
section.heading: Safe atmosphere
section.content: No tool shall be used in an atmosphere containing flammable vapours, flammable gases or explosive dusts.

subsection.content: Suitable protective equipment shall be provided and maintained in good condition for the use of every operator.
Every operator shall, while using a tool, wear the protective equipment provided for him under paragraph (1).

section.name: s15
section.heading: Action when defect discovered
section.leadIn: If the operator of a tool discovers a fault or defect in the tool, or in any pins or cartridges provided for use therewith, he shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: cease to operate the tool; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: forthwith report the fault or defect to the contractor or proprietor employing him.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Person under 18 not to use tools
section.content: No person under the age of 18 years shall be permitted to use a tool.

section.name: s17
section.heading: Misuse of tools, etc.
section.leadIn: No person shall misuse or, without reasonable excuse, interfere with—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any tool, pin or cartridge; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any protective equipment provided under regulation 14(1).

subsection.leadIn: A contractor engaged in construction work on a construction site or a proprietor of any other industrial undertaking—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in or in respect of which regulation 4, 5, 6, 7, 9, 10, 11, 12, 14 or 16 is contravened commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in or in respect of which regulation 8 is contravened commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in or in respect of which regulation 13 is contravened commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine of $400,000. (5 of 2023 s. 45)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: contravenes regulation 6, 7, 9(2) or (3), 11, 14(2) or 15 commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: contravenes regulation 13 commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine of $150,000. (5 of 2023 s. 45)

subsection.content: Any person who contravenes any of the provisions of regulation 17 commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 5. (L.N. 39 of 1994)

section.name: s19
section.heading: Commissioner may approve tools
section.content: The Commissioner may approve a cartridge-operated fixing tool by notice in the Gazette.
